intro: Chondroscaphe merana, commonly known as the mountain rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Alps and surrounding regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and windy conditions. Chondroscaphe merana thrives in rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountainous environments.
